A1.explanation: Con 'I' siempre usamos 'am' en presente simple del verbo 'to be'.

A1.prompt: There ___ two cats in the garden.
___ apple a day keeps the doctor away.
A1.explanation: Usamos 'an' antes de palabras que comienzan con sonido vocálico.

A1.prompt: What color is the sky on a clear day?

A1.explanation: El desayuno se toma por la mañana.

A1.prompt:
Read: 'My name is Ana. I live in a small town with my family.'

Where does Ana live?
A1.explanation: El texto dice 'I live in a small town'.
Tercera persona singular añade -s al verbo en presente simple.

A2.prompt: They haven't seen ___ for a long time.
A2.explanation: Después de 'seen' se necesita un pronombre objeto.

A2.prompt: We have lived here ___ five years.
A2.explanation: 'For' se usa con periodos de tiempo.

A2.prompt: If it ___ tomorrow, we'll stay home.
A2.explanation: En la cláusula 'if' del primer condicional se usa presente simple.

A2.prompt: She asked me ___ I could help her.
A2.explanation: Se usa 'if' para preguntas indirectas sí/no.
Las preguntas en pasado simple comienzan con 'did'.

A2.prompt:
Read: 'The museum opens at 10 a.m. and closes at 6 p.m.'

What time does the museum close?
A2.explanation: El texto indica que cierra a las 6 p.m.

A2.prompt: I'm looking forward to ___ you soon.
A2.explanation: 'Look forward to' va seguido de gerundio.

B1.prompt: If I ___ you, I would take that job.
B1.explanation: El segundo condicional usa 'were' para todas las personas.

B1.prompt: She said she ___ the news already.
B1.explanation: Estilo indirecto con acción anterior usa pasado perfecto.

B1.prompt: You need to study hard to ___ the exam.
B1.explanation: Después de 'to' usamos la forma base del verbo.

B1.prompt: We were late because the train ___ by the time we arrived.
B1.explanation: Una acción completada antes de otra en el pasado usa pasado perfecto.

B1.prompt:
Read: 'Laura moved to London last year. She now works for an international company and studies English every evening.'

Why does Laura study every evening?
options: Because she wants to improve English
B1.answer: Because she wants to improve English
B1.explanation: El texto indica que estudia inglés cada tarde, implícitamente para mejorar.

B1.prompt: The meeting was postponed ___ next week.
B1.explanation: Se usa 'until' para expresar aplazamiento hasta un momento específico.

B1.prompt: Neither the teacher nor the students ___ ready.
B1.explanation: Con 'neither...nor' el verbo concuerda con el sujeto más cercano (students).

B1.prompt: By the time I finish this course, I ___ in London for two years.
B1.explanation: El futuro perfecto describe duración hasta un punto futuro.

B1.prompt: She is responsible ___ the marketing campaign.

options: Although he was tired, but he finished the assignment.
Although he was tired he finished the assignment.
Although he was tired, he finished the assignment.
Although he was tired; he finished the assignment.
B2.answer: Although he was tired, he finished the assignment.
B2.explanation: 'Although' no se combina con 'but' y requiere coma antes de la oración principal.

B2.prompt: Choose the correct expression: I regret ___ to university earlier.
B2.explanation: 'Regret' seguido de gerundio para acciones pasadas.

B2.prompt: The project will be finished by the time you ___ back.
B2.explanation: Después de 'by the time' se usa presente simple para referirse al futuro.

B2.prompt: Had he known about the traffic, he ___ earlier.
B2.explanation: Tercer condicional con inversión requiere 'would have + participio'.

B2.prompt: Select the best word: The scientist presented a highly ___ argument.
___ had the meeting started when the fire alarm rang.
B2.explanation: 'Hardly had...when' es la inversión correcta para eventos casi simultáneos.

B2.prompt:
Read: 'The new policy aims to reduce waste by encouraging departments to share resources and track consumption.'

What is the purpose of the policy?
options: To monitor and lower resource waste
B2.answer: To monitor and lower resource waste
B2.explanation: El texto menciona reducir desechos y rastrear consumo.

B2.prompt: The proposal lacks ___ and needs revision.
We need a solution that is ___ with our long-term strategy.

C1.prompt: Her speech was so ___ that everyone listened attentively.
Choose the sentence with correct parallel structure:
options: He not only enjoys to read but also writing poetry.
He not only enjoys reading but also to write poetry.
He enjoys not only reading but also writing poetry.
He enjoys reading not only but also writing poetry.
C1.answer: He enjoys not only reading but also writing poetry.

C1.prompt: The findings were ___ to the theory.
C1.explanation: 'Incompatible' significa que no concuerdan con la teoría.

C1.prompt: The director demanded that every team member ___ the new policy.
C1.explanation: Verbos de mandato en subjuntivo usan la forma base.

C1.prompt: Despite the committee's ___ objections, the project moved forward.
C1.explanation: Se necesita un adjetivo que describa las objeciones.

C1.prompt: The researcher presented a ___ analysis that impressed the panel.
C1.explanation: Se requiere un adjetivo para describir 'analysis'.

C1.prompt: Not only ___ to the conference, but she also delivered the keynote.
C1.explanation: Inversion con 'not only' usa auxiliar + sujeto + verbo base.

C1.prompt:
Read: 'The report underscores the importance of cross-functional collaboration to accelerate innovation.'

What does the report emphasize?
C1.explanation: El texto resalta la colaboración interfuncional.

C1.prompt: The consultant recommended that the contract ___ reviewed annually.
The company will have to ___ the new regulations.

C2.prompt: Which sentence demonstrates correct use of the subjunctive mood?
options: If I was you, I would travel more.
It's essential that he be informed immediately.
She suggested that he goes to the doctor.
I wish I was invited to the party.
C2.answer: It's essential that he be informed immediately.
C2.explanation: 'Be' es la forma subjuntiva correcta tras expresiones de necesidad.

options: She decided to take the bull by its horns and confront her boss.
He let the cat out from the bag by mistake.
They hit the nail on the head with their solution.
She burned the midnight light to finish the report.
C2.answer: They hit the nail on the head with their solution.
C2.explanation: Es la única expresión idiomática usada correctamente.

C2.prompt: Choose the option that best completes the sentence: Hardly had I arrived at the station ___ the train left.
No sooner ___ the announcement made than the phones rang.
C2.explanation: 'No sooner had ... than ...' requiere pasado perfecto.

C2.prompt: Had it not been for her dedication, the project ___ .
C2.explanation: Condicional mixto con inversión usa 'would have failed'.

C2.prompt: The judge ordered that the documents ___ submitted by Friday.
Select the sentence that uses inversion correctly.
options: Rarely I have seen such dedication.
Rarely have I seen such dedication.
Rarely have seen I such dedication.
Rarely I seen have such dedication.
C2.answer: Rarely have I seen such dedication.
C2.explanation: Las expresiones negativas iniciales requieren inversión auxiliar-sujeto.

C2.prompt: The professor's explanation was so ___ that even experts were challenged.
C2.explanation: 'Esoteric' describe algo comprensible solo para especialistas.

C2.prompt: Despite ___ evidence to the contrary, he maintained his position.
The policy was designed to ensure that resources were allocated ___.
